name: InterContinental Melbourne The Rialto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. had a very nice feel to it and the rooms were lovely. i was very impressed with the buffet breakfast - really godo selection and love buffet breakfasts where chef's cook the eggs on the spot. would happily stay there again. very convenient, very friendly staff. only two glitches were the rooms are rather dark given you look into an internal atrium and the hot water didnt work (we had to change rooms- not even upgraded for the inconvenience of it all!!!). oh, and the lights around the pool area/spa are really dark after the sun goes down - would hate to be doing laps post- sunset . to end on a high note i think the gym was very nice.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice room with a seatee and a huge bathroom with separate shower and bath but the hotel lacks any warmth or atmosphere due to its design and architecture. Service was not that hot either so i dont think i would return to this hotel even though i am an Ambassdor level member which does not really count for much as i have found in Australia (no recognition of the fact)
reviews.title: Lack of atmosphere

reviews.text: Collins Street location is good. The Southern Cross train station is within a few blocks as is the river walk and its restaurants and casino. The building is a pleasure. It is two 1891 Venetian styled buildings joined by a glass roof over what is now the hotel restaurant but originally an alleyway. Valet parking is available. My room was fairly small, but with all amenities. Iron and board, robe/slippers, hair dryer, wall safe big enough for most laptops and equipped with AC power inside the safe to charge while storing, 32”LCD TV, 3 phones, kettle and tea/coffee, wired and wireless internet ($29 for 24 hours, $10 for one), scale, Bose i-pod stand, newspaper, rain shower but no tub and a balcony overlooking the dining area. What I did not like was a credit card surcharge of 1.5% and the internet charges. I did like the blending of 19 century architecture with modern décor, the comfortable duvet covered bed and the trendy room furnishings. Since the 5 star Rialto has a gym, pool and business centre combined with all above it might be the best stay in all of Melbourne.
reviews.title: Euro style deluxe

reviews.text: Hotel Intercontinental - The Rialto certainly impresses when you first enter with the massive glass atrium between the 2 historic buildings containing the rooms, however entering the room you are in an ultra modern room with everything you would expect from its 5 star rating. The room was well appointed, with a large plasma TV, desk which is excellent for business and comfortable bed. The bathroom, although large enough for one, lacked a bath tub, and the massive shower leaked a large quantity of water out onto the rest of the bathroom floor which did not drain away - poor design. As impressive as the view from the room out over the atrium was, the room did suffer from a lack of natural light. As can often be the case, extras not included in the room rate such as the internet access and breakfasts were rather over-priced, but overall a hotel which would be equally welcome by business travellers or couples after some indulgence. Located a 5 minute walk from Southern Cross Station, and 15 minutes walk or a short tram trip to the main shopping precinct of Melbourne.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but small faults do detract

reviews.text: A couple of friends and I decided to stay at the Intercontinental for my 18th- we wanted a trendy hotel right in the city to come back to after nights out. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by staff and excited by the lovely architecture and aesthetics within the hotel (also a complimentary bottle of champange and a happy birthday card from the concierge)The intercontinental managed to live up to expectations.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great service
A lot of downfalls
reviews.text: The hotel is very modern which is a big positive close to transport and quite central. Now to the downside. They had a big problem cleaning the hotel which is not good as when you check in as I dont want toenails on the floor and others peoples dirt on the floor. They also allowed children in the gym and someone urinated in the sauna. It was a shambles over weekend so all i can do is blame the fact that there were no managers on duty which I was later informed as it was Easter. You cant blame the holiday season though as the hotel industry is a 360 day a year business...

The hotel has excellent location, being right in the city centre ,couple of blocks away from Flinders station. The hotel itself has a rustic , yet modern feel.The rooms are nicely done equipped with flat screen tvs. Would definitely love to stay ther again.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel in a prime spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved our stay here. Room was spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Beautiful room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Architecture was great, loved the 'old & new' in the foyer. Close walk to city & about 10mins from river & casino.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: Rooms were not that clean asked 3 times for them to cleaned and finally ok.. It was good to get back to the city from the tropical climate and insects.. but was not very impressed someone urinated in the sauna which stank I can not explain the smell and they left it on. So after that i did not want to stay a it felt dirty. Also was very quiet and not busy. It is very modern though.. Spoke to manager and he was very sorry and said in his 20 years of business had not had this happen in a sauna. I can imagine so i left.
reviews.title: Great location with clean and modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped through the automatic doors of The Intercontinental Melbourne The Rialto, we knew we had arrived at a place that lived up to it's excellent reputation.
reviews.title: Luxury and service second to none!

reviews.text: The rooms overlooking the centrally positioned Alluvial Restaurant and Bar is not only strikingly unqiue, but also gave a sense of al-fresco dining.
reviews.title: Great location but tiny rooms and shocking service

reviews.text: As all the other reviews suggest, this hotel is deservingly one of the best many have stayed at, including us. Having been to a few nice hotels both in Australia and overseas, The Rialto here is all you can expect from an Intercontinental.
reviews.title: Excellent room + ambience but NO SERVICE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The King Premium room was very well furnished, with nice trims and the usual toiletries. The automatic blinds are a nice standard as was the well-supplied mini bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic Room

reviews.text: The very large bathtub was great, as was the walk-in shower. From the Bose stereo system to the 32inch Plasma TV, the room all-in-all was 42 square metres of luxury.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service - but poor internet and ended up with wet clothes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with pretty much everything during our stay at The Rialto. The room was modern and clean, the bed was comfortable, the service at checkin and in the bar and restraunt was top notch and the breakfast was good. While it is reasonable to expect these things in a 5 star hotel, often hotels fail to deliver. For once a 5 star hotel worth its rating.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at the Intercontinental in Sydney earlier in the year I found the Melbourne version very similar in style,etc. Set in an obviously historic building gives the hotel a suave sophisticated feel. But being a historic building I guess it hampers major redevelopment. Which leads me to the hotel's frontage.
reviews.title: Great hotel but leave your car at home if you can

reviews.text: Being an interstate visitor staying at the hotel for the 1st time we found it hard to find the hotel as there is not an obvious "driveway" for the hotel. We missed the small indented "driveway" for the hotel the 1st time and had to go around the block. For those visiting for the 1st time look for the taxi rank and it is just after that.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but bad service i received.

reviews.text: Also there is no carpark under the hotel and your only option is a $50/night valet fee or park it yourself away from the hotel in a carpark as suggested by the valet guy. If you're not a local how would you know where these are? So this basically forces you to valet park. On the valet parking they were always friendly and quick to bring the car around. $100 well spent - maybe. Would add up if you stay for awhile hence my intial comment to leave your car at home if you are a local.
reviews.title: Great choice for those who appreciate the little extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was elegant and adequately appointed - Bose stereo with Ipod connection a nice touch. Pay TV stations a litle lacking in options. Bed was comfortable but pillows a little soft. Turn down service was o.k but no free water like Sydney intercontinental offered and my wife was miffed there was only chocolates on the 1st night.
reviews.title: Great service to make up for shortcomings

description: Celebrated as one of the world’s hottest and best new hotels by both Conde Nast Traveler and Wallpaper* magazines, InterContinental Melbourne The Rialto is a fascinating example of the city’s fusion of old and new. InterContinental Melbourne The Rialto represents the resurrection of one of the city’s last remaining examples of 19th Century Victorian Gothic architecture into a timeless and inspiring luxury hotel. Its city centre location on Collins Street is at the heart of the laneways, attractions and experiences that give Melbourne its international appeal. Behind the Gothic façade is a sleek yet intimate hotel that is home to two very different bars – the Bluestone Wine Lounge and the Market Lane Bar – and a variety of dining establishments, including Alluvial Restaurant and Guy Grossi’s exciting new venture, Merchant. InterContinental Melbourne The Rialto has also teamed up with Shannon Bennett, providing valet parking for his new Vue de monde restaurant on the 55th floor of the adjacent Rialto building. InterContinental Melbourne The Rialto’s warmth and exceptional service belies its size, with more than 250 guest rooms across two soaring wings, including a stunning collection of suites as well as the exclusive Club InterContinental lounge and facilities for premium guests. The hotel’s rooftop is also a destination itself, home to the kitchen’s own market garden and beehives, the Scandinavian-inspired swimming pool and the glass-encased fitness centre overlooking the Melbourne cityscape. Also available is the luxurious candle-lit East Day Spa offering east-meets-west treatments and therapies. Before guests arrive, they can take advantage of the concierges’ passion and Insider knowledge of the city. Chief Concierge, James Ridenour and his team are the key to authentic experiences of the real Melbourne and everything the city has to offer.
